text: This is just an amazingly soothing and relaxing song. One of my favorite songs ever.
author: GÃ¶sta Reinhardt

text: Having never heard this until tonight, I was 99% certain that this was RPG village music. There's a certain, "earthy happiness" tone that seemingly all RPG's use in order to make their villages say, "we're simple, yet happy folk!" Not saying this is bad, per se, just pointing out an obvious trope.
author: MrRaindog

text: MrRaindog Well to be fair, most folk song are made to capture and deliver that kind of feeling. So this song did a good job on that!
author: budakbaong siah

text: My favourite Suikoden 3 music. Often stopped in on the way to/from the mountains just to hear it
author: Genkaku

text: May I ask where the image came from?  I can't seem to find it online, and I like it!  Thanks once again for posting these songs, it's wonderful

text: Where was the indication that he might be wrong?  If it was there I missed it.

text: Underrated game, Suikoden II is miles better but this one was good too.

text: @wiegraf9009 They recently announced a new one for the PSP.
author: FlamingGnats

text: This game had its faults, but it had an AMAZING OST and Luc was a great antagonist.  I'm still convinced he was right and the protagonists were wrong.  The Thomas part was wonderful as well.  If only Suiko 6 would get made and they could finish off the series!  I want a conclusion dammit!
author: wiegraf9009

text: That was really beautiful, and I love the image.
author: xcrossx

text: Put Hugo on Fubar, then plow through everything that stands in your way!
author: Sephiko

text: Boom. Nostalgia bomb. I can't believe I failed to put this one on my playlist.

text: If there is anything that suikoden games have going them music wise, they make some of the best town themes.
